div.p: RB MSS M42, Library, Royal Botanic Garden Melbourne.

See also husums-phanerogamische-Flora
in this edition. Supplementum

[Second supplement to Brown’s Prodromus florae Novae Hollandiae et insulae Van Diemen
R.Brown (1810), to which Brown had subsequently published a ‘first supplement’ (R.Brown(1830)).
enumerating more recently discovered Australasian and New Zealand plants (excluding new Preissian species
Lehmann (1844-7).
) compiled by the author Dr Ferdinand Müller, Adelaide, southern New Holland, 1849.
The MS was not completed in 1849. Additions were inserted at later dates, as indicated by differences in handwriting and pen. Some of the references M cited were published after 1849.
]

panicula laxa effusa pauciflora, glumarum valvis inaequalibus flosculis 1/2 brevioribus, palea inferiore obtusa, arista nulla, flosculi intermedii palea superiore apice bifida ciliata, foliis angusti linearibus scabridis, calmis elongatis basi ramosis foliosis.

Baxter.
Hierochloa rariflora
...Baxter. is on a page preceding the title page of MS. See J. Hooker(1844-7), pt.1, p. 93.The reference is toWilliam Baxter fl 1820s-1830s.

Diplax avenacea Raoul N.Z. W. Ann.
Walpers (1848-71). M also refers to this source by using 'W.A.', 'W.', or 'Walp.'
1, 921.
Diplax avenacea ... 921. inter.
Hierochloe rariflora Hk fil v. pag. [confer]

Paspalum vaginatum Sw. N.H. tr.
Novae Hollandiae tropicae.

n. 421 Paractamum
P. paractaenum?
Kth N.H.

Stipa (37) crinita Gdch. N.H. occ.
Novae Hollandiae occidentalis [= western New Holland].

Agrostis (79) stichophylla
A. distichophylla?
R. & S. N.H.

Pappophorum (7) coerulescens
P.
caerulescens?
Gdch. N. H. occ.

avenaceum, virens & flavescens Ldl. Mtch
Lindley in Mitchell (1848).

Poa falcata Gdch. N.H. occ. (Eragr.)
Eragrostis falcata.

Sprengelii Kth. N.H. or.
Novae Hollandiae orientalis [= eastern New Holland].

Danthonia pectinata Ldl in Mtch. 3 exp. II, 26,
Mitchell (1838). M uses variations of the number 3 or 'tres' as well as 'exp.' with a volume number to distinguish the two-volume Mitchell (1838) from Mitchell (1848).
spica simplici secunda pleiostachya pectinata foliis multo longiore, palea inferiore villosissima, laciniis lateralibus membranaceis aristae aequalibus.

P. laevinoda
Panicum laevinode?
Ldl. in Mtch. tres. exp. I, 238
Actually p. 235.
N. H. austr-orient & subtrop. panicula compos. contract. capillari, ramis pedicellisque flexuosis, spiculis acutis glabris, gluma exteriore rotundata laxa interiore 5 nervi, foliis vaginis geniculisque laevibus glabris.
M transposed the last two words.

Danthonia eriantha Ldl. in Mtch. 3 exp. II, 307
Actually p. 304.

panicula subcoarctata lanceolata, spiculis sub 4-floris gluma laevi
M transposed this word and the one before it.
multo brevioribus, palea exteriore laevigata basi apiceque vilosissima, aristis lateralibus subulatis debilibus intermedia brevioribus, foliis setaceis vaginisque patentim pilosis, collo barbato.

Aristida ramosa Br Lachlan
Danthonia eriantha ... Br Lachlan is on the following page of the MS — 'vide pag. seq.'

Danthonia lappacea Ldl.
in Mtch. three exp. I, 313.
Actually p. 309.

spicis geminatis foliis brevioribus, palea inferiore sericea cornea, laciniis
'l ciniis' in Mitchell (1838), p. 304.
lateralibus foliatis divaricatis arista rigida brevioribus.
[between the Darling and Bogan Rivers. Mitchell]
Aira Australis Raoul. N. Z. W. 1, 932
Dichelachne sp.1-9. W. Ann. III, 725 Streptachne sp 1-2. Stipa sp 30-31.

Dactyloctenium radulans Mtch. trop. A.
Mitchell (1848).

Eleusine marginata Ldl. in Mtch. 3. exped. I, 319.
Actually p. 315.
culmo tereti glabro, foliis glabris, ligula nulla, spicis digitatis strictis, spiculis subsexfloris, palea inferiore carinata mucronata marginata.

Cyperus (78) Lessonianus Kth. m. coer.
Montes caerulei (Blue Mountains, NSW).

Caustis Sieberi Kth
Kunth (1833-50). M also uses the abbreviation 'K' to refer to these volumes.
307

C.
Carex. These two entries were inserted later, on the next page.
subdola, Boott N.Z. W. anal 1, 910.

C. Gunniana Boott V.DL,
Van Diemen's Land (Tasmania).
914

Trig. calcaratum Hook. N.H., W. Ann 1, 768
M inserted this and the two following entries on an otherwise blank page.

T. centrocarpum Hk. Sw. riv.
Swan River, WA.

T. callicarpa
T.
calcitrapa?
Hk Sw. riv.
O. Cygnorum Planchon Swan River Walp. III, 510.
Luzula Banksiana E. Mey. N.Z. W. An III, 653
L. crinita Hk. f. W. Ann. 1, 877. Auckl. isl

Juncus filiformis L. N.Z. 3, 319.
Actually p. 318. M frequently only gives volume and page numbers, or less often only page numbers, when he is referring to Kunth (1833-50).

G. ciliata Hk. f. ins. Auckl.
Auckland Islands.
W. ann. 1, 897.

G. pallida Hk. f. ins. Camb.
Campbell Island.
W. l.c.

Xerotes typhina Ldl.
in Mitch. 3 exp 2, 41

Xerotes effusa Ldl. in M. 3
exp. II, 101
acaulis, foliis linearibus longissimis semiteretibus margine scabris dorso striatis, apice dentato tabescente, panicula mascula effusa abbreviata, bracteis acuminatus scariosis pedecello brevioribus.
Murray river (X. fragrans?) nahe der Vereinigung mit dem Darling

Xyris elongata Lamb. Kth 4, 21. P.J.
Port Jackson, NSW.

10. B. semibarbata Haw. P.J. m. Tasm
Tasman Sea, NSW.

18. T. Manglesianus Kth. Sw. riv., Baie des Chien m.
Baie des Chiens Marins = Seal Bay, SA? (cf. German Seehund).
Aut hoc genus (sine dubia cl. Allanio Cunningham dicatum) et tuncAllania foribundum aut Allania Bth genus Guianense deleendum erit.
C. Rossii Hk.f. W. An. 1, 857. Campbell & Auckl. isl.
Blandfordia marginata W. Walp. Ann. 1, 868. N.H.
Dianella graminifolia K & B N.H. W. ann. 1, 871
Cordyline spectabilis K & B. l.c. N.H.
Phormium Cookianum Le Jol. N. Zeel. W. an. III, 630

Calostemma candidum
Lindl. in Mtch three exped. I, 54.
foliis ..., tubo perianthii limbo multo breviore, corona truncata dentibus sterilibus nullis, umbellis densis, pedicellis articulatis exterioribus multo longioribus.
In solo fertili ad limites occidentales Novae Cambria australis frequens juxta fl. Nammoy. Fragrans.
C. candidum in volum II p. 30 tali modo describitur: floribus centralibus subsessilibus, articulo infra medium in pedicellis longioribus, corona integerrima
[At the Lachlan River on the plains]

Calostemma carneum
Ldl. in Mtch 3 exp. II, 39.
foliis ..., tubo perianthii limbo subaequali, corona truncata dentibus sterilibus nullis, umbellis densis, pedicellis articulatis exterioribus longioribus

Anigozanthus
Anigozanthos?
tyrianthina Hk. Sw. riv. W. An III, 624.
